article.headline: UNC Greensboro 68, Georgia Southern 47
article.story: STATESBORO, Ga. (AP) -- Kyles Hines scored 20 points and grabbed 13 rebounds and UNC-Greensboro went on a strong second half run in a 68-47 victory over Georgia Southern on Saturday. The Eagles (6-6, 0-2 Southern Conference) went 14:37 minutes without a field goal in the second half as Greensboro (3-3, 3-1) went on a 32-4 run. Rick Hickman had 18 points and Mikko Koivisto added 16 off the bench. Georgia Southern led 35-29 at halftime, then went up by eight points with 17:47 in the game before the run started. Koivisto, who made 4-of-6 beyond the arc, opened the scoring with a layup and Hickman added a score off a steal. Hines made a layup to give Greensboro a 48-43 lead with 10 minutes to play, then Koivisto hit a 3-pointer to spark a 16-0 run. Donte Gennie scored 17 points and Dwayne Foreman added 10 points and five assists for the Eagles.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
